long_description:
If you’re planning to be in New York for May 19-20, you might want to consider fasting for a couple of days in preparation for a weekend of culinary delight. The city will be hosting four exceptional food, beer and coffee festival that are sure to please the newbies and the gourmands. Continue reading to find out more.

 

Why not start the day with a trip to Brooklyn for the New York Coffee Con? You might be looking for your coffee fix, but you’ll soon find that there’s so much more to a cup of coffee than meets the eye. Coffee Con focuses on teaching all attendants everything there is to know about growing, brewing, tasting and appreciating coffee. From from 10am to 4pm, you’ll have the opportunity to taste coffee of over more than 40 exhibitors, participate in seminars, panels and classes.

 

Stay in Brooklyn and head to the Five Boro Craft Beer Fest from 4pm to 9pm to drink craft beers, eat and listen to live music. Dozens of breweries will set camp at The Well Brooklyn to give tastings to anyone eager to try their creations. This outdoor beer fest will feel and taste like summer.

Manhattan will play host to two annual food festivals that bring together the best selection of international and vegetarian food. You’ll find the 9th Avenue International Food Festival along Ninth Avenue between 42nd and 57th Streets—a Mecca of exquisite dishes from all over the world created by local restaurants. As a plus, a stage at 55th Street will play tunes all weekend long.

 

Vegetarians and vegans can go instead to the NYC Vegetarian Food Festival at the Metropolitan Pavilion to indulge in plant-based food from over 125 vendors. What’s more, health professionals, authors and educators will share the knowledge, experiences and expertise in conferences and panels.


If you don’t have a room yet for these events, check out the Royalton New York’s special offers and book your room today!
